page.title: 19River Brain
page.content: The only river to pass through this area is the River Brain which is a tributary of the River Blackwater. The river is only 14 miles long from its source near Great Bardfield (where it is known as Pod's Brook)until it joins the Blackwater just south of Witham. The section of the river near White Notley is quite attractive and there are footpaths nearby but the paths are oftrn very muddy and this is one of the reasons why there are willow beds close to the river. The road from the village to the railway station crosses the river by an old iron bridge which has a weight restriction on it for traffic. Next to the bridge is a ford and when the water level is low this pretty spot is popular with children for games. The Essex Way footpath crosses the river at White Notley.
